summary: Diff adds a TanStack Router app shell with header/footer layout, reusable UI cards (program/pricing/trainer/testimonial), contact form and business info components wired to React Query hooks, and a Motoko backend actor with contact submission and business info query methods. Several key requirements cannot be verified due to omitted/truncated files (notably page implementations and static assets). Some backend/API pieces appear unrequested (trap methods for WhatsApp/call/maps).

missing_requirements.requirement: Smooth scrolling for in-page anchor navigation where applicable.
missing_requirements.reason: No evidence of any smooth-scroll behavior (e.g., CSS scroll-behavior, scroll-to handlers) in the shown added files; only normal route navigation is present.

missing_requirements.requirement: Persist contact form submissions in the backend actor.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend defines `let submissions = List.empty<ContactSubmission>();` with no `stable` storage, and uses `submissions.add(newSubmission)` on a value that appears immutable; based on the shown code there is no clear persistent state mutation/retention across calls/upgrades.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add generated image assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and wire them into pages/cards.
missing_requirements.reason: No generated image assets are shown in the diff summary, and no references to `/assets/generated/...` appear in the shown components.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend methods for WhatsApp/call/maps that intentionally trap (initiateWhatsApp, callNow, openGoogleMaps).
hallucinated_features.reason: The request specifies WhatsApp/tel/Google Maps should be external links handled in the frontend (no API integration). Adding backend trap methods is extra functionality not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend query endpoints for business info (getPhoneNumber/getAddress/getOpeningHours).
hallucinated_features.reason: Business info only needed to be displayed on the Contact page; fetching it from backend via dedicated methods is not explicitly requested (though it may be acceptable).
